definition: to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: The Conductor's analytical mind helps her to ensure that no detail goes unconsidered.
sentences.chinese: 售票员的分析的头脑帮助她，以确保所有细节都几。

sentences.english: But one month later, the bus conductor was murdered too.
sentences.chinese: 但二个月后，公车售票员也被谋杀了。

sentences.english: The conductor will announce the stops.
A bus conductor caught the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 一个公车售票员抓住了罪犯。

sentences.english: Ma Lin is a bus-driver, his wife a conductor.
sentences.chinese: 马林是女共汽车司机，他的妻子是售票员。

sentences.english: Ask the worker who sells tokens to give you one.
sentences.chinese: 给站在那边的售票员元，他会给你一个辅币。

sentences.english: And without conductors, the whole courseof taking buses will be much simpler.
sentences.chinese: 而且，没有售票员，整个乘车过程会更加简单。

sentences.english: There is no conductor in city bus now.
sentences.chinese: 现在城市公交上没有售票员。

sentences.english: The money was passed on from one to another until it reached the conductor's hand.
sentences.chinese: 钱由一人传给另一人，最后到达售票员手里。

sentences.english: Can you see the conductor over there?
sentences.chinese: 你看到那边的售票员了吗？

sentences.english: The money was passed on from one to another until it reached the conductor's hands .
sentences.chinese: 钱由一人传递给另一人，一直递到售票员的手里。

sentences.english: The money was passed on from one to another until it reached to the conductor's hands.
sentences.chinese: 钱由一人传给另一个人，最后一直传到售票员的手里。

sentences.english: Just give the man standing there 3 yuan and he'll give you a token.
sentences.chinese: 给站在那边的售票员元，他会给你一个辅币。

sentences.english: The new conductor, Andrew, is a handsome and warm-hearted young man.
sentences.chinese: 新来的售票员安德鲁是个热心肠的帅小伙。

sentences.english: The conductor shambled to the next carriage.
sentences.chinese: 售票员慵懒地拖着脚走向下一节车厢。

definition: attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
